author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after the police booked actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui for allegedly manhandling a young woman from his building over a parking issue, the actor on Monday registered a complaint against some members of the society for “manhandling” his wife.

On Sunday evening, the Versova police registered a complaint of outraging a woman’s modesty against Mr. Siddiqui, after a 24-year-old neighbour alleged that he had manhandled her. On Monday, Mr. Siddiqui went to the police station for inquiries in connection with the case, and while there, told the police that his wife had been manhandled and intimidated on Sunday night.

Mumbai Police spokesperson Dhananjay Kulkarni said: “In his complaint, Mr. Siddiqui has said that five people barged into his office in Andheri around 8.35 p.m. on Sunday, about four hours after the complaint against him was registered, and got into an argument with his wife Aliyah. He has further said the five accused manhandled her.”

An officer of the Versova police added that the five accused named by Mr. Siddiqui in his complaint include the chairman of his society, and the grandmother of the 24-year-old woman who lodged a complaint against him.

Mr. Siddiqui has been embroiled in a dispute with his fellow residents over parking in his building compound.

On Sunday, the 24-year-old complainant allegedly saw Mr. Siddiqui’s personal security guards forbidding a resident from parking his two-wheeler in a space that Mr. Siddiqui was allegedly using without permission, and the complainant took photos of the incident. Shortly thereafter, Siddiqui is alleged to have manhandled the woman.
title: Bollywood actor files counter complaint
